answer:
The answer is (Dutch, Flanders, French, German).

The Netherlands are bordered to the southeast by Belgian waters. Dutch is the official language. Flanders is the northern Flemish-speaking region of Belgium. Although Flemish is a dialect of Dutch, it is a distinct language, largely due to centuries of historical separation and isolation.
